title: U.S. - forecast for higher education outlays 2019 to 2030
yAxis: Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars for 12 number of Fiscal Years.
The maximum Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars 33.0 is found at Fiscal Year '19 and the minimum is found at '20 where Fiscal Year is 2.0.
The difference of Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Fiscal Year is 31.0.

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fiscal Year in the x axis and Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The maximum Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars 33.0 is found at Fiscal Year '19 and the minimum is found at '20 where Fiscal Year is 2.0.
The second highest Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars is appeared to be the Fiscal Year '22.
There is a difference of 31.0 between the maximum Fiscal Year '19 and minimum Fiscal Year '20.
The Fiscal Year '19 has the highest Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars, followed by '22, and '22. Down to the Fiscal Year '20 which is the lowest.
Fiscal Year '30, '29, '28, '27, '26, '25, '24, '23, and '22 share the same value 5.0.
The Fiscal Year '20 has 4.71 times less Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars than average.
Summing up the values of all Fiscal Years, we get total 84.0.
